security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill that provides guidance on running Nx generators. The skill file contains no executable code, makes no network requests, does not access the filesystem beyond its own content, and does not execute external commands. The referenced MCP tools are legitimate Nx tooling for generator discovery and execution.

content.user_title: Run Nx generators for monorepo code generation
content.value_statement: Generating code in monorepos requires navigating complex project structures and selecting the right generator. This skill prioritizes workspace-plugin generators for custom solutions and guides you through running generators with proper verification steps.
actual_capabilities: Prioritizes workspace-plugin generators for custom internal tooling
Lists available Nx generators with schema information
Provides command syntax for running generators
Guides dry-run preview before applying changes
Verifies generated code with tests and formatting
limitations: Does not execute generators directly, requires user to run nx commands
Does not create or modify Nx workspace configuration
Does not install or update Nx packages
Does not manage generator options or presets

use_cases.description: Scaffold new features, libraries, and components across multiple projects in an Nx workspace

use_cases.description: Run custom workspace-plugin generators to maintain and update internal tooling and configurations

use_cases.title: Automate version migrations
use_cases.description: Execute migration generators for version updates and configuration changes across projects

prompt_templates.title: List generators
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me the available Nx generators in this workspace

prompt_templates.title: Generator schema
prompt_templates.prompt: What options are available for the @nx/workspace-plugin:create-nodes-plugin generator

prompt_templates.title: Preview changes
prompt_templates.prompt: Run a dry-run of the @nx/react:component generator for my new component

prompt_templates.title: Run generation
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a new Node.js library called utils in the shared directory

output_examples.input: Generate a new React component called Button in the ui package
output: To generate the Button component, run: nx generate @nx/react:component Button --project=ui --export
The generator will create Button.tsx and Button.spec.tsx files
After generation, remember to run: nx affected -t test to verify tests pass
Format the new files with: npx prettier --write apps/my-app/src/lib/button/*

best_practices: Check workspace-plugin generators first for custom solutions
Use --dry-run flag to preview changes before applying
Format and test generated code immediately after generation
Commit generator changes separately from manual edits
anti_patterns: Using core generators when workspace-plugin generators have custom solutions
Skipping the dry-run preview before running generators
Forgetting to run tests after generating new code
Not formatting generated code before committing

faq.question: What Nx versions are supported?
faq.answer: Works with Nx 16+ workspaces. Check your nx.json for version compatibility.

faq.question: What are the generator limits?
faq.answer: Generator availability depends on installed plugins. Core Nx and workspace plugins are prioritized.

faq.question: Can I integrate with CI pipelines?
faq.answer: Yes. Use nx generate in scripts and nx affected -t test,lint,build for CI validation.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: This skill only reads generator documentation. No data is stored or transmitted externally.

faq.question: Why is my generator not found?
faq.answer: Ensure the plugin is installed and listed in nx.json. Use mcp__nx-mcp__nx_generators to list available generators.

faq.question: How does this compare to nx CLI?
faq.answer: This skill provides guidance and best practices. The actual nx CLI commands must be run manually in the terminal.
